page.title: 17SHELFORD-ATTITUDES
page.content: The people in Shelford had moved into the area for a number of reasons,some to work on the farms,one to work in the public house,one to work in the Post Office,others because they preferred the quiet life of a village to that of a town.Some inhabitants have remained in the village all their lives. All the people questioned were of one mind as to the disadvantages of living in Shelford.They all felt that they needed somewhere to buy provisions and a more regular bus service.There is no shop and there are only 4 buses a day from Shelford Village to Nottingham. Several clubs and societies cater for all the age groups.There are Girl Guides,Boy Scouts,Cubs,Brownies, a Youth Club,Mothers' Union,Women's Institute and an Over Sixties Club.
